name: places/ChIJ3dvT1E9YwokRoywVkHxTm6c
formattedAddress: 548 W 48th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 548 W 48th St, New York, NY 10036, USA

editorialSummary.text: Unassuming hotel offering straightforward rooms with flat-screens, plus free hot breakfast & Wi-Fi.

originalText.text:
Location is great! 10 minute walk to Time Square. The hotel itself was terrible. It smelt musky when we walked in, the room had very obviously not been cleaned (the trash had not been taken out, and there were still water droplets on the counter). It was too late to get the room cleaned though, so we had to deal with it.
I’m about 98% sure the room had bed bugs. We stayed one night and by the time I got home the next day, I had large red bumps all over my arms and legs and they itches like mad.
If you’re staying here, PLEASE check your bed first - no one deserves to go on vacation and wind up bringing an infestation back home from lack of cleaning.

originalText.text: We stay here for 3 nights. The first issue we ran into was with parking. I reached out before made booking and was told they are affiliated with Icon parking, which would be $32.50. Even on Expedia, it says about the parking and the cost. We get to the parking location, and it is closed to be refurbished. Call the front desk, and they tell me they are set up with another place. we go there, and they say no call front desk they tell me they are and will give me a stamp when I get there. Check into the hotel, and they told me they gave the wrong parking place. They gave me the correct address and went to move my car after paying over $50 for 2 hours. Get to the icon parking, and they tell me it's going to be $67 call hotel and they tell me that they will give me a stamp at then, and it will be okay. Well, this was not the case at all. Spend over $200 for parking. Reach out to General Manger multiple times and have never been in contact with them. Thr rooms had a funny smell and weren't the cleanest. The breakfast was a joke they had cut up hot dogs and never seen that. The area for breakfast is extremely small and was overcrowded. The wifi was horrible it kept going out on us and didn't work more than it did. The only thing goo I can say about this place is its location to cruise port and time square. If you are considering his hotel, keep looking at this is not where you want to stay

originalText.text: It was very convenient in the end. Close to the Intrepid and to most of the important visiting points. Breakfast was a good plus. The rooms are little, but if you are on vacation you'll be out most of the day and only going back to rest, so they're alright. Employees are great, good people!

text.text: It was very convenient in the end. Close to the Intrepid and to most of the important visiting points. Breakfast was a good plus. The rooms are little, but if you are on vacation you'll be out most of the day and only going back to rest, so they're alright. Employees are great, good people!

originalText.text:
Aah it's a tough one. On the plus side the location isn't bad being so close to Times Square. That being said it is still quite a walk when you have suitcases.
I echo what others say about the small rooms. I have no issue with this as we didn't spend much time in the hotel it is simply somewhere to sleep and shower. But they could make the rooms so much better.
Get rid of the waste of space desk. No one goes to work in the hotel, we don't need a desk we needed somewhere to put our suitcases.
Take the fridge and microwave off the floor and put them on a shelf so we don't have to kneel down to use. Or honestly get rid of them!
Have some hooks on the walls to hang coats, and some better shelves to put things.
Re-hang the bathroom door so it opens outwards so you dont have to climb over the toilet to exit the room.
Basic, simple changes would make a huge improvement.

On the plus side, the bed was great!!

Breakfast is a disgrace!! They have four tables for all the guests. There is space for more so unsure why they haven't added more. People were having to eat off their lap while perched on a bench. This isn't on, it really is not fair for paying guests.
The food selection isn't the best and eating from paper plates with plastic cutlery is naff!! Needs serious improment!!

originalText.text:
The front desk concierge, Fatima were very accommodating, attentive, and friendly. Location was perfect for water front and navigating the city.

Room rating based on comparisons of price and accommodation. If there were more amenities offered / available I would have rated it higher but overall - for what I needed, it worked!
